error.invalid_backbone_key: Invalid backbone key. 32 hexadecimal digits expected.
error.invalid_individual_address:
Value does not match pattern for KNX individual address.
'area.line.device'
error.keyfile_invalid_signature: The password to decrypt the `.knxkeys` file is wrong.
error.keyfile_no_backbone_key: The `.knxkeys` file does not contain a backbone key for secure routing.
error.keyfile_no_tunnel_for_host: The `.knxkeys` file does not contain credentials for host `{host}`.
error.keyfile_not_found: The specified `.knxkeys` file was not found in the path config/.storage/knx/
error.no_router_discovered: No KNXnet/IP router was discovered on the network.
error.no_tunnel_discovered: Could not find a KNX tunneling server on your network.
error.unsupported_tunnel_type: Selected tunneling type not supported by gateway.

data_description.connection_type: Please select the connection type you want to use for your KNX connection.

connection_type.description:
'Automatic' performs a gateway scan on start, to find a KNX IP interface. It will connect via a tunnel. (Not available if a gateway scan was not successful.)

'Tunneling' will connect to a specific KNX IP interface over a tunnel.

'Routing' will use Multicast to communicate with KNX IP routers.
connection_type.title: KNX connection

data_description.host: IP address or hostname of the KNX/IP tunneling device.
data_description.local_ip: Local IP or interface name used for the connection from Home Assistant. Leave blank to use auto-discovery.
data_description.port: Port used by the KNX/IP tunneling device.
data_description.route_back: Enable if your KNXnet/IP tunneling server is behind NAT. Only applies for UDP connections.
data_description.tunneling_type: Select the tunneling type of your KNX/IP tunneling device. Older interfaces may only support `UDP`.

manual_tunnel.description: Please enter the connection information of your tunneling device.
manual_tunnel.title: Tunnel settings

data_description.individual_address: KNX address to be used by Home Assistant, e.g. `0.0.4`
data_description.multicast_group: Multicast group used by your installation. Default is `224.0.23.12`
data_description.multicast_port: Multicast port used by your installation. Default is `3671`
data_description.routing_secure: Select if your installation uses encrypted communication according to the KNX IP Secure standard. This setting requires compatible devices and configuration. You'll be prompted for credentials in the next step.

menu_options.secure_routing_manual: Configure IP Secure backbone key manually

secure_key_source_menu_tunnel.description: How do you want to configure KNX/IP Secure?

menu_options.secure_knxkeys: Use a `.knxkeys` file providing IP Secure keys

secure_key_source_menu_tunnel.title: KNX IP Secure

data_description.knxkeys_file: Select a `.knxkeys` file. This can be exported from ETS.
data_description.knxkeys_password: The password to open the `.knxkeys` file was set when exporting.

secure_knxkeys.description: The keyring is used to encrypt and decrypt KNX IP Secure communication. You can import a new keyring file or re-import to update existing keys if your configuration has changed.
secure_knxkeys.title: Import KNX Keyring

data_description.backbone_key: Can be seen in the 'Security' report of your ETS project. Eg. `00112233445566778899AABBCCDDEEFF`
data_description.sync_latency_tolerance: Should be equal to the backbone configuration of your ETS project. Default is `1000`

data_description.device_authentication: This is set in the 'IP' panel of the interface in ETS.
data_description.user_id: This usually is tunnel number +1. So first tunnel in the list presented in ETS would have User-ID `2`.
data_description.user_password: Password for the specific tunnel connection set in the 'Properties' panel of the tunnel in ETS.

secure_tunnel_manual.description: Please enter your IP Secure information.
secure_tunnel_manual.title: Secure tunneling

data.tunnel_endpoint_ia: Select the tunnel endpoint used for the connection.

data_description.tunnel_endpoint_ia: 'Automatic' selects a free tunnel endpoint for you when connecting. If you're unsure, this is the best option.

data.gateway: Please select a gateway from the list.

data_description.gateway: Select a KNX tunneling interface you want use for the connection.

entity.device_description: A device allows to group multiple entities. Select the device this entity belongs to or create a new one.
entity.entity_category_description: Classification of a non-primary entity. Leave empty for standard behavior.
entity.entity_description: Optional if a device is selected, otherwise required. If the entity is assigned to a device, the device name is used as prefix.
entity.name_description: Define how the entity should be named in Home Assistant.
entity.title: Entity configuration

sync_state.description: Actively request state updates from KNX bus for state addresses.
sync_state.title: State updater

binary_sensor.description: Read-only entity for binary datapoints. Window or door states etc.

context_timeout.description: The time in seconds between multiple identical telegram payloads would count towards an internal counter. This can be used to automate on multi-clicks of a button. `0` to disable this feature.
context_timeout.label: Context timeout

ga_sensor.description: Group address representing a binary state.
ga_sensor.label: State

ignore_internal_state.description: Write each update to the state machine, even if the data is the same.
ignore_internal_state.label: Force update

reset_after.description: Reset back to “off” state after specified seconds.
reset_after.label: Reset after

section_advanced_options.description: Properties of the binary sensor state.
section_advanced_options.title: State properties

climate.description: The KNX climate platform is used as an interface to heating actuators, HVAC gateways, etc.

default_controller_mode.description: Climate mode to be set on initialization.
default_controller_mode.label: Default mode

fan_max_step.description: The maximum amount of steps for the fan.
fan_max_step.label: Fan steps

fan_zero_mode.description: Set the mode that represents fan speed `0`.
fan_zero_mode.label: Zero fan speed mode

ga_active.description: Binary value indicating if the device is active or idle. If configured, this takes precedence over valve position.
ga_active.label: Active

ga_controller_status.description: HVAC controller mode and preset status. Eberle Status octet (KNX AN 097/07 rev 3) non-standardized DPT.
ga_controller_status.label: Controller status

ga_fan_swing.description: Toggle (vertical) fan swing mode. Use this if only one direction is supported.
ga_fan_swing.label: Fan swing

ga_valve.description: Current control value / valve position in percent. `0` sets the climate entity to idle.
ga_valve.label: Valve position

ignore_auto_mode.description: Enable when your controller doesn't support `auto` mode. It will be ignored by the integration then.
ignore_auto_mode.label: Ignore auto mode

section_activity.description: Determine if the device is active or idle.
section_activity.title: Activity

section_controller_mode.description: Set the mode of the climate device.
section_controller_mode.title: Controller mode

section_heat_cool.description: Set whether the device is in heating or cooling mode.
section_heat_cool.title: Heating/Cooling

section_on_off.description: Turn the device on or off.
section_on_off.title: On/Off

section_operation_mode.description: Set the preset mode of the device.
section_operation_mode.title: Operation mode

section_operation_mode_individual.description: Set the preset mode of the device using individual group addresses.
section_operation_mode_individual.title: Individual operation modes

ga_setpoint_shift.description: Target temperature deviation from a base setpoint.
ga_setpoint_shift.label: Setpoint shift

max_temp.description: Maximum temperature that can be set.
max_temp.label: Maximum temperature

min_temp.description: Minimum temperature that can be set.
min_temp.label: Minimum temperature

group_direct_temp.description: Set the target temperature by an absolute value.
group_direct_temp.label: Absolute setpoint

group_setpoint_shift.description: Shift the target temperature from a base setpoint.
group_setpoint_shift.label: Setpoint shift

setpoint_shift_max.description: Highest allowed deviation from the base setpoint.
setpoint_shift_max.label: Maximum setpoint shift

setpoint_shift_min.description: Lowest allowed deviation from the base setpoint.
setpoint_shift_min.label: Minimum setpoint shift

temperature_step.description: Smallest step size to change the temperature. For setpoint shift configurations this sets the scale factor of the shift value.
temperature_step.label: Temperature step

cover.description: The KNX cover platform is used as an interface to shutter actuators.

ga_position_set.description: Group addresses for setting a new absolute position.
ga_position_set.label: Set position

ga_position_state.description: Group addresses reporting the current position.
ga_position_state.label: Current position

ga_step.description: Group addresses for stepwise movement. Used to stop the cover when no dedicated stop address is available.
ga_step.label: Stepwise move

ga_up_down.description: Group addresses triggering a full movement.
ga_up_down.label: Open/Close control

invert_position.description: Invert telegram payload before processing. Enable if KNX reports 0% as fully closed.
invert_position.label: Invert position

invert_updown.description: Default is UP (0) to open a cover and DOWN (1) to close a cover. Enable this to invert the open/close commands from/to your KNX actuator.
invert_updown.label: Invert open/close

section_travel_time.description: Used to calculate intermediate positions of the cover while traveling.
section_travel_time.title: Travel time

travelling_time_down.description: Time in seconds the cover needs to fully close.
travelling_time_down.label: Time for closing

travelling_time_up.description: Time in seconds the cover needs to fully open.
travelling_time_up.label: Time for opening

light.description: The KNX light platform is used as an interface to dimming actuators, LED controllers, DALI gateways and similar.

color.description: Control the color of the light.

ga_red_brightness.description: Group address to control the brightness of the color channel. Required.
ga_red_brightness.label: Red brightness

ga_red_switch.description: Group address to switch the color channel on/off.
ga_red_switch.label: Red switch

ga_white_brightness.description: Group address to control the brightness of the color channel.
ga_white_brightness.label: White brightness

hsv_addresses.description: Hue, saturation and brightness controlled by individual group addresses.
hsv_addresses.label: HSV

individual_addresses.description: RGB(W) using individual group addresses for each color channel's state and brightness.
individual_addresses.label: Individual addresses

single_address.description: RGB, RGBW or XYY color controlled by a single group address.
single_address.label: Single address

color.title: Color

ga_brightness.description: Control the absolute brightness of the light.
ga_brightness.label: Brightness

section_color_temp.description: Control the color temperature of the light.
section_color_temp.title: Color temperature

switch.description: The KNX switch platform is used as an interface to switching actuators.

ga_switch.description: Group address to switch the device on/off.
ga_switch.label: Switch

invert.description: Invert payloads before processing or sending.
invert.label: Invert

respond_to_read.description: Respond to GroupValueRead telegrams received to the configured send address.
respond_to_read.label: Respond to read

extra_fields_descriptions.destination: The trigger will listen to telegrams sent or received on these group addresses. If no address is selected, the trigger will fire for every group address.

service_exposure_remove_not_found.message: Could not find exposure for `{group_address}` to remove.

data_description.rate_limit:
Maximum outgoing telegrams per second.
`0` to disable limit. Recommended: `0` or between `20` and `40`
data_description.state_updater:
Sets the default behavior for reading state addresses from the KNX Bus.
When enabled, Home Assistant will monitor each group address and read it from the bus if no value has been received for one hour.
When disabled, state addresses will only be read once after a bus connection is established.
This behavior can be overridden for individual entities using the `sync_state` option.
data_description.telegram_log_size: Telegrams to keep in memory for KNX panel group monitor. Maximum: {telegram_log_size_max}

event_register.description: Adds or removes group addresses to knx_event filter for triggering `knx_event`s. Only addresses added with this action can be removed.

address.description: Group address(es) that shall be added or removed. Lists are allowed.
address.name: [%key:component::knx::services::send::fields::address::name%]

remove.description: Whether the group address(es) will be removed.
remove.name: Remove event registration

type.description: If set, the payload will be decoded as given DPT in the event data `value` key. KNX sensor types are valid values (see {sensor_value_types_url}).
type.name: Value type

event_register.name: Register knx_event

exposure_register.description: Adds or removes exposures to KNX bus. Only exposures added with this action can be removed.

address.description: Group address state or attribute updates will be sent to. GroupValueRead requests will be answered. Per address only one exposure can be registered.
address.name: [%key:component::knx::services::send::fields::address::name%]

attribute.description: Attribute of the entity that shall be sent to the KNX bus. If not set the state will be sent. Eg. for a light the state is eigther “on” or “off” - with attribute you can expose its “brightness”.
attribute.name: Entity attribute

default.description: Default value to send to the bus if the state or attribute value is None. Eg. a light with state “off” has no brightness attribute so a default value of 0 could be used. If not set (or None) no value would be sent to the bus and a GroupReadRequest to the address would return the last known value.
default.name: Default value

entity_id.description: Entity ID whose state or attribute shall be exposed.
entity_id.name: Entity

remove.description: Whether the exposure should be removed. Only the 'Address' field is required for removal.
remove.name: Remove exposure

type.description: Telegrams will be encoded as given DPT. 'binary' and all KNX sensor types are valid values (see {sensor_value_types_url}).
type.name: Value type

exposure_register.name: Expose to KNX bus

read.description: Sends GroupValueRead requests to the KNX bus. Response can be used from `knx_event` and will be processed in KNX entities.

address.description: Group address(es) to send read request to. Lists will read multiple group addresses.
address.name: [%key:component::knx::services::send::fields::address::name%]

read.name: Read from KNX bus

send.description: Sends arbitrary data directly to the KNX bus.

address.description: Group address(es) to write to. Lists will send to multiple group addresses successively.
address.name: Group address

payload.description: Payload to send to the bus. Integers are treated as DPT 1/2/3 payloads. For DPTs > 6 bits send a list. Each value represents 1 octet (0-255). Pad with 0 to DPT byte length.
payload.name: Payload

response.description: Whether the telegram should be sent as a `GroupValueResponse` instead of a `GroupValueWrite`.
response.name: Send as Response

type.description: If set, the payload will not be sent as raw bytes, but encoded as given DPT. KNX sensor types are valid values (see {sensor_value_types_url}).
type.name: Value type

send.name: Send to KNX bus
